courses.course_desc: This course introduces students to various healthcare fields and their roles as health care providers.  Students will examine the history of the respective fields, educational and credentialing requirements, job functions, perspective job outlooks and salaries.
courses.course_credits:
3 Credit Hours 
3 Lecture Contact Hours 
0 Lab Contact Hours
courses.course_attributes: Course Attribute(s): Dif Tui- Health Professions

courses.course_desc: This course provides students with the knowledge and skill related to access and barriers to healthcare.  Additionally, the healthcare providers role in past and current health policy and healthcare delivery will be emphasized. Evaluation of quantitative global and U.S. healthcare data in relation to healthcare systems and evidence-based practices will be analyzed. Ethical topics will be discussed. This course is for non-nursing majors.
courses.course_credits:
3 Credit Hours 
3 Lecture Contact Hours 
0 Lab Contact Hours
courses.course_attributes: Course Attribute(s): Exclude from 3-peat Processing|Dif Tui- Health Professions

courses.course_name: Foundations in Interprofessional Education and Collaborative Practice
courses.course_desc: This course introduces students to the foundational principles of interprofessional education and collaborative practice in healthcare. Students will examine the history, purpose, and best practices of team-based client and patient care, including the enabling, reinforcing, and interfering factors related to interprofessional education and practice. (WI) Prerequisite: [HA 3308 or HI 3301] and HS 1310 all with a grade of a "D" or better.
courses.course_credits:
3 Credit Hours 
3 Lecture Contact Hours 
0 Lab Contact Hours
courses.course_attributes: Course Attribute(s): Dif Tui- Health Professions|Writing Intensive

courses.course_name: Principles of Accounting for Healthcare Managers
courses.course_desc: This course provides an introduction to accounting useful in healthcare facilities and agencies, and demonstrates the application of accounting principles and techniques in the healthcare field.
courses.course_credits:
3 Credit Hours 
3 Lecture Contact Hours 
0 Lab Contact Hours

courses.course_desc: This course provides an introduction to the culture of a foreign country, with an emphasis on wellness, the health care environment, and language in the healthcare setting. Prerequisite: Instructor approval.
courses.course_credits:
3 Credit Hours 
3 Lecture Contact Hours 
0 Lab Contact Hours

courses.course_name: Capstone for Bachelor of Science in Health Sciences
courses.course_desc: This course will provide students with the opportunity to reflect on their studies as a whole and explore how they will use the knowledge they have obtained in their future career.  Students will investigate career opportunities available to them after graduation and develop professional skills to ensure success post-graduation.  Prerequisite: HS 1310 with a grade of "D" or better.
courses.course_credits:
3 Credit Hours 
3 Lecture Contact Hours 
0 Lab Contact Hours
courses.course_attributes: Course Attribute(s): Dif Tui- Health Professions|Writing Intensive

courses.course_desc: This course provides an overview of legal, regulatory, and ethical issues in healthcare.  Topics include patient consent, privacy, confidentiality, torts, contract law, corporate liability, employment, labor, malpractice, antitrust, fraud and abuse, and key federal regulations. (WI).
courses.course_credits:
3 Credit Hours 
3 Lecture Contact Hours 
0 Lab Contact Hours
courses.course_attributes: Course Attribute(s): Dif Tui- Health Professions|Writing Intensive

courses.course_name: Introduction to Financial Management for Health Sciences
courses.course_desc: This course is designed to prepare health professionals for managerial positions in healthcare organizations by providing sufficient knowledge of industry financial matters so they can provide input to the organization's chief executive officer.

3 Credit Hours

courses.course_desc: This course is designed to prepare allied health professionals in a leadership degree program for managerial positions in healthcare organizations by providing sufficient knowledge of industry financial matters so they can provide input to the organization's chief executive officer.

courses.course_name: Policy Development in the Healthcare Arena
courses.course_desc: Students will analyze changing healthcare paradigms to determine decision-points where policies can be affected. Course allows students to apply existing skills to real world policy issues at state and national levels and to analyze policy development from numerous stakeholders viewpoints.
